column4: Hey, I'm installing Ubuntu on my Dad's laptop - this is the first time I've seen the Install inside Windows option - what advantages does it have over having a separate partition for Ubuntu?
Hey, I'm installing Ubuntu on my Dad's laptop - this is the first time I've seen the Install inside Windows option - what advantages does it have over having a separate partition for Ubuntu?
it allows you to install ubuntu without splitting up existing partitions - which can be a pain
So having not to worry about partitions is the only advantage?
pretty much - what do you mean by access files directly?
As in if you install inside Windows with the wubi.exe utility, then windows can copy files from ubuntu without having to restart and vice-versa?
And would you be able to boot into ubuntu from within windows?
I am not sure that windows can read files off of a wubi install - as the wubi install is in a file itself
but the reverse is true .. a wubi install can read files off of a windows partition
I think it makes a file. There's definitely no partition involved.
thats what i think too -- if thats the case, then windows has no real ability of reading into that file
run.  sudo apt-get clean   #and try again
it gave me the same error all over again
well, what commands did you run? what error are you getting?  put this up on a pastebin so we can have a look.
